images.copyright: Sheep grazing in snow, Iceland (© Christophe Lehenaff/Getty Images)
images.title: Feasting through frost
images.caption: Þorrablót, Icelandic midwinter festival
images.desc: When January's chill grips Iceland, locals turn to warmth and tradition with Þorrablót—a midwinter festival rooted in Viking heritage. Named after Þorri, a winter figure from Norse mythology, this celebration began as a sacrificial feast to honor the gods and ensure survival through harsh winters. Today, it's a lively cultural event that blends history with hearty camaraderie.
